job.title: Specialization
job.value: Junior Full Stack and Qlik Developer

objectives.title: Objectives
objectives.value: I am interested in development for Android and IOS, especially the backend.

how.title: How did I decide to pursue this?
how.first_phrase: Since my childhood, I've always had a fascination with computers and video games.
how.second_phrase: Upon entering the first year of Compulsory Secondary Education (ESO), I decided to delve into learning a programming language, and the choice was the C language.
how.third_phrase: Throughout the years of ESO, I developed several simple applications as I gradually acquired programming knowledge.
how.forth_phrase: It was in the first year of high school when I started exploring the fundamentals of HTML, a crucial language for web development.
how.fifth_phrase: At that point, I made the decision to become a programmer.
how.sixth_phrase: Upon completing high school, I chose to pursue the higher degree in Multiplatform Application Development (DAM).

first_project.value: Execution of various projects (Currently in development).
first_project.description: | Applications and Web as gifts for family members.

second_project.value: Execution of a project (Currently in development).

forth_project.description: | Website to showcase and manage a client's portfolio.

first_course.value: Completion of a YouTube course about HTML and CSS (In progress).

second_course.value: Completion of a Udemy course about Ionic.

third_course.value: Completion of a Udemy course about .NET.

header.title: My Experience
header.description: My path in the world of programming.

first_section_month.first_phrase: Started the first year of the Multiplatform Application Development (DAM) higher degree.
first_section_month.second_phrase: Began learning Java (up to loops and arrays), HTML, CSS, SQL and RSS.

first_section_month.first_phrase: Continued the first year of DAM until completion in May.
first_section_month.second_phrase: Continued learning Java (lists, collections, Java 8, basics of MySQL databases and desktop interfaces; collaborated on my first desktop interface project), SQL and XML.

second_section_month.first_phrase: Started the second year of DAM.
second_section_month.second_phrase: Began learning Spring (along with the use of MongoDB databases), Laravel, Flutter, Python and Django.
second_section_month.third_phrase: Simultaneously, started developing collaborative projects for each subject using those languages/frameworks.

second_section_month.first_phrase: Started an internship at Controlnet Web S.L.
second_section_month.second_phrase: Received training in Qlik Sense for two weeks.

third_section_month.first_phrase: Collaborated on various MERCANZA projects using Qlik Sense for the Community of Madrid.
third_section_month.second_phrase: Completed the final project for the DAM higher degree.

forth_section_month.first_phrase: Finished the internship at Controlnet Web S.L.
forth_section_month.second_phrase: Graduated and obtained the DAM higher degree.

fifth_section_month.first_phrase: I learn JavaScript and ViteJS thanks to Fernando Herrera's course 'Modern JavaScript: Guide to mastering the language'. I apply what I learned in the educational projects of the course.

sixth_section_month.first_phrase: I learn TypeScript, Angular and NestJS, in addition to Docker, thanks to Fernando Herrera's course 'Angular: From zero to expert'. I apply what I learned in the educational projects of the course.

eighth_section_month.first_phrase: Started developing FrutyFest, a website for a Minecraft event for ByFruty, Twitch streamer, and YouTuber.

first_section_month.first_phrase: Continued FrutyFest and released the 'beta' version of the website.
first_section_month.second_phrase: Updated my personal website. Changed its organization, short-term plans, projects, and Quality of Life for the site.

second_section_month.first_phrase: I deepened my knowledge in Flutter thanks to Fernando Herrera's course 'Flutter - Mobile: From zero to expert'.
second_section_month.third_phrase: Create a mobile application project as a gift for my father for his birthday.

third_section_month.first_phrase: I finish developing the FrutyFest website.
third_section_month.second_phrase: Create a mobile application project as a gift for my mother for her birthday.

internet.title: Projects Hosted on the Internet
internet.description: Projects that I have on the web or available for download.

first_project.first_phrase: The project is an application that streamlines catalog management for companies and allows customers to place orders interactively.
first_project.second_phrase: For companies, it provides login and catalog management functions, viewing with filters, and customer suggestion management.
first_project.third_phrase: Customers, after registration and validation, explore catalogs, manage a cart, provide suggestions, and generate orders with additional confirmation.
first_project.forth_phrase: The administrator oversees user management, company data, products, categories, suggestions, and orders, maintaining complete control over the application.
first_project.fifth_phrase: In summary, it enhances interaction and efficiency in order management between companies and customers.

second_project.first_phrase: The FrutyFest website, an event organized by ByFruty, Twitch streamer, and YouTuber, provides information about past and future editions of the event.
second_project.second_phrase: It features a table with selected participants and a ranking based on the scores obtained.
second_project.third_phrase: To participate, users must register and be selected by an administrator, who can also manage teams and game modes in the database.
second_project.forth_phrase: During the event, administrators rate each game mode according to established rules.

collaborative.title: Collaborative Local Projects
collaborative.description: Local projects developed during the school period for subject learning, done with classmates.

first_project.first_phrase: This is a website with an administration and user system.
first_project.second_phrase: Users must register to access the content of the page.
first_project.third_phrase: The administrator is responsible for adding offers and items.
first_project.forth_phrase: Users can view available offers and apply to them.
first_project.fifth_phrase: After applying, they have the option to generate a PDF with the offers they have applied to, which they can send by email or download directly.

second_project.first_phrase: It is a website that involves an administrator, teachers, and students.
second_project.second_phrase: Teachers have the ability to create news and evaluate students enrolled in their subjects.
second_project.third_phrase: Students can enroll in subjects from any teacher and view their corresponding grades.

third_project.first_phrase: It is a mobile application developed in Flutter that allows wholesale companies to add products to a database and assign them prices.
third_project.second_phrase: In addition, retail companies can register as users to place orders with wholesale companies.
third_project.backend: Backend: Laravel API developed by the teacher (Abandoned)
